title: Public Records Request – DUI/Child Neglect Arrest of Alexandra Alcala – January 11, 2025 (Palmetto Expressway)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to the following public records related to the January 11, 2025 arrest of Alexandra Mackenzie Alcala by Miami-Dade deputies for DUI and child neglect:

All body-worn camera footage from Deputy Felicia Kinsey-Smith and any other deputies involved.

All dash camera footage from patrol units involved in the stop, arrest, or transport.

All rear-seat (in-cruiser) camera footage, particularly while Ms. Alcala was detained or in custody.

Any records documenting notification to DCF (Florida Department of Children and Families), including timestamps and call logs.

Incident Summary (per media sources):

Name: Alexandra Alcala

Date of Arrest: January 11, 2025

Time: Approx. 11:40 PM

Location: Northbound Palmetto Expressway (near NW 12th Ave → NW 37th Ave), Miami Gardens

Agency: MDSO, with FHP and Miami Gardens PD assisting

Charges:

3x Felony Child Neglect

DUI (BAC .14%/.15%)

Resisting Arrest (Misdemeanor)

Arresting Deputy: Felicia Kinsey-Smith

Involved Agencies: MDSO, FHP, Miami Gardens PD

Incarceration Site: Turner Guilford Knight Correctional Center

Bond: $3,500

The request is made in the public interest to inform the public about police protocol, DUI enforcement involving minors, and interagency response to child endangerment. This is not for commercial use, and I request a waiver of any applicable fees. Please provide all responsive records in digital format, if possible.

If any material is withheld, please provide the statutory exemption and release any segregable, redacted content.

Thank you for your time and transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Arrest of Alexis Mackenzie Franke – August 2, 2024 (I-95 DUI / Taser Incident)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request all available public records related to the arrest of Alexis Mackenzie Franke on or around August 2, 2024, by Florida Highway Patrol troopers following a DUI rollover crash in North Miami, near NW 135th Street on northbound I-95.

Specifically, I request:

All body-worn camera footage from FHP troopers involved in the incident and arrest.

All dash camera footage from FHP cruisers that responded to or documented the scene.

All in-vehicle (rear-seat) camera footage, including while Ms. Franke was detained or transported.


Incident Overview (from public media):

Name: Alexis Mackenzie Franke

Age: 24

Residence: Phoenix, Arizona

Date/Time: August 2, 2024, approx. 1:20 AM

Location: Northbound I-95 near NW 135th Street, North Miami, FL

Charges:

Aggravated Assault on Law Enforcement Officer (felony)

Resisting Arrest with Violence (felony)

Resisting Arrest without Violence (misdemeanor)

DUI (x2) – refusal of field sobriety and breath test

The subject was reportedly taken into custody after attempting to deploy a trooper’s Taser, following a single-vehicle DUI crash. She was booked into the Turner Guilford Knight Correctional Center on a $10,000 bond.

This request is made in the public interest to promote transparency regarding law enforcement practices during high-risk roadside arrests involving potential weapon disarmament, DUI, and use-of-force protocols.

I am not seeking these records for commercial purposes and respectfully request a waiver of all applicable fees. I prefer that responsive records be delivered in digital format. If any part of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemption under Florida law and release redacted records where applicable.

Please confirm receipt and inform me of any expected cost or production time.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Arrest of Maya Aleasa Goldsmith – March 2023, Mallory Square

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Florida Public Records Act, Chapter 119 of the Florida Statutes, I respectfully request access to the following public records relating to the arrest of Maya Aleasa Goldsmith, which occurred at or near Mallory Square Park in Key West, Florida, around 9:30 AM on or about March 23, 2023:

All body-worn camera footage from responding officers, including but not limited to Officers William Howell and Raymond Roscoe.

All dash camera footage from any patrol units involved.

All rear-seat (in-cruiser) camera footage, especially during transport or detainment.

The complete incident and arrest reports, including narrative summaries, use-of-force reports, officer statements, and 911 call logs or transcripts related to this incident.

The CAD (Computer-Aided Dispatch) log for all units responding to Mallory Square Park for this incident.

Incident Reference (per media):

Subject: Maya Aleasa Goldsmith

Date: Approx. March 23, 2023

Time: Approx. 9:30 AM

Location: Mallory Square Park, Key West, FL

Charges:

Battery on a Law Enforcement Officer (x2, felony)

Resisting Arrest (felony and misdemeanor counts)

Misuse of 911 (felony)

Disorderly Conduct (misdemeanor)

Officers Named: Officer William Howell, Officer Raymond Roscoe

Initial Contact Trigger: Refusal to leave public restroom, profanity-laced tirade, then false 911 call

Booking Jurisdiction: Monroe County Jail

Arraignment Date (per press): May 26, 2023

This request is made in the public interest, not for commercial use. The incident involved physical contact with law enforcement, public misconduct, misuse of emergency services, and occurred in a high-visibility public location. The release of these materials will contribute to transparency and understanding of public safety practices and First Amendment-related policing.

I request that records be provided in digital format, if possible, and respectfully request a waiver of any fees, as this request benefits public awareness. If any portion is withheld, please cite the statutory exemption under Florida law and release all segregable portions.

Please confirm receipt of this request and notify me of any timelines or costs associated with fulfillment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: CORA Request – Arrest of Tawni Michell Roberts – January 13, 2024 (Ref: P2400060)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting public records regarding the arrest of Tawni Michell Roberts on January 13, 2024, for multiple violations of a protection order at 410 Tucker Street (Alpine Apartments), Craig, CO 81625.

Specifically, I request access to:

All body-worn camera footage from Craig Police officers involved in the response and arrest.

All dash camera footage from patrol vehicles present on scene.

All rear-seat (in-cruiser) camera footage, including while Ms. Roberts was in transport or custody.


Incident Details:

Name: Tawni Michell Roberts

Gender: Female

Race: White

Age at Arrest: 32

Height/Weight: 5'1", 125 lbs

Hair/Eyes: Brown / Blue

Arrest Date: January 13, 2024

Time: Approx. 8:22 PM

Location: 410 Tucker Street (Alpine Apartments), Craig, CO 81625

Reference ID: P2400060

Charge(s): Violation of a Protection Order (x4)

This request is made in the public interest, not for commercial use. The nature of this arrest—repeated protection order violations—raises important questions about police response, officer conduct, and enforcement of court-ordered restrictions. I respectfully request a waiver of any applicable fees and that records be provided digitally if available.

If any material is withheld, please cite the specific statutory exemption under CORA and provide redacted versions where possible.

Thank you for your assistance and transparency. Please confirm receipt and provide an estimated completion timeline.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Right-to-Know Request – Arrest of Ismael Anthony Rodriguez Jr. – April 7, 2024 (Ref: CAR2024-04-0434)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting public records relating to the arrest of Ismael Anthony Rodriguez Jr. on April 7, 2024, following a short vehicle pursuit and physical altercation with officers at the 200 block of N Bedford Street in Carlisle, PA.

Specifically, I request:

All body-worn camera footage from officers involved in the traffic stop, pursuit, and arrest.

All dash camera footage from Carlisle Police vehicles involved.

All available rear-seat (in-cruiser) camera footage from any transport of Mr. Rodriguez Jr.

The complete incident and arrest reports, including officer narratives, probable cause affidavit, pursuit documentation, and any traffic citations.

Incident Summary:

Name: Ismael Anthony Rodriguez Jr.

DOB: Approx. 2004 (19 at time of arrest)

Race/Gender: Hispanic Male

Height/Weight: 5'10", 145 lbs

Arrest Date: April 7, 2024

Time: Approximately 7:45 PM

Location: 200 block N Bedford Street, Carlisle, PA 17013

Reference ID: CAR2024-04-0434

Charges:

Resisting Arrest (M2)

Obstructing Administration of Law (M2)

Fleeing or Attempting to Elude Police Officer (M)

Plus 8 related traffic offenses

According to the department’s report, Mr. Rodriguez Jr. made an illegal lane change, evaded a traffic stop, and resisted arrest after being pulled over. This request is made in the public interest as it pertains to law enforcement pursuit, use of force, and the public’s right to access records of police conduct.

I request a waiver of any fees, as this is not for commercial use and the information sought will contribute to public oversight. Please provide responsive records in digital format, and notify me if redactions or exclusions apply, citing the relevant statutory exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: CORA Request – Arrest of Erlene Hernandez – July 10, 2024

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to public records related to the arrest of Erlene Hernandez on July 10, 2024, in Trinidad, Colorado.

Specifically, I am requesting the following materials:

All body-worn camera footage from Trinidad Police Department officers involved in this arrest.

All dash camera footage from police vehicles present on scene.

All rear-seat (in-cruiser) camera footage, including footage during transport or detainment.

The full and complete incident and arrest reports, including officer narratives, booking documentation, and any supplemental or evidence-related reports.

Incident Details:

Name: Erlene Hernandez

Gender: Female

Race: White

Age at Arrest: 41

Height/Weight: 5'3", 245 lbs

Hair/Eyes: Brown / Brown

Date of Arrest: July 10, 2024

Location: Trinidad, CO 81082

Charges:

Third Degree Assault

Obstruction of a Peace Officer/Firefighter/EMT

Disorderly Conduct (Offensive Utterance/Gesture/Display in Public)

Resisting Arrest

Tampering with Physical Evidence

According to reports, Ms. Hernandez was arrested after arriving at the scene of a crash she was not involved in and subsequently engaged in allegedly obstructive and assaultive behavior toward responding officers. This request is made in the public interest to provide transparency into the police response and arrest procedures in a volatile, multi-charge incident.

I am not requesting these records for commercial purposes and therefore respectfully request a waiver of all applicable fees. If any portion of this request is denied, please cite the specific statutory exemption under CORA and provide redacted versions where possible. I request that all responsive records be provided in digital format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Right-to-Know Request – PSP Involvement in Arrest of Omar J. Dickens – December 25, 2024

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Pennsylvania Right-to-Know Law, I am requesting all available public records relating to the Pennsylvania State Police's assistance during the December 25, 2024 arrest of Omar J. Dickens, following a burglary at Lowe’s (2002 Chemical Road, Plymouth Township).

Specifically:

Any PSP unit logs, reports, or narratives documenting PSP assistance on scene.

Any dashcam or bodycam footage from responding PSP troopers (if applicable).

Any inter-agency communications, dispatch logs, or support documentation regarding PSP’s role in this arrest.

Context: Dickens fled in a box truck, struck a cruiser, fled on foot, and was apprehended with assistance from multiple agencies, including PSP, near the train tracks behind the Metroplex. The primary incident was logged by Plymouth Township Police.

This is a non-commercial request made in the public interest. Please provide digital records where possible. If denied, please explain with statutory justification and redacted records where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Right-to-Know Request – K9 Involvement in Arrest of Omar J. Dickens – December 25, 2024

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to the following public records concerning your department’s role in the arrest of Omar J. Dickens on December 25, 2024, during a multi-agency response to a burglary at Lowe’s, 2002 Chemical Road, Plymouth Township:

All body-worn camera footage from Whitemarsh Township Police officers who responded, including K9 Officer Jim Sweeney and K9 Diesel.

All dash camera footage from any Whitemarsh patrol vehicles on scene.

All reports, use-of-force documentation, K9 deployment logs, or narratives generated by Whitemarsh officers.

All radio logs or communications relevant to Whitemarsh PD's response to this incident.

Incident Summary:

Suspect: Omar J. Dickens

Date/Time: December 25, 2024 – approx. 10:38 AM

Location: 2002 Chemical Road → Train tracks behind the Metroplex

Assisting Agency: Whitemarsh Township PD

Role: K9-assisted apprehension from drainage pipe

Lead Agency: Plymouth Township Police Department

This request is in the public interest, relating to law enforcement actions during a high-risk pursuit involving a K9 apprehension. I request a waiver of all fees and digital delivery where available. If any records are withheld, please provide legal justification per RTKL.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Arrest of Hannah Lecomte – July 11, 2024 (Ref #24HI-212-AR)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to the following public records relating to the arrest of Hannah Lecomte on July 11, 2024, by the Hillsboro Police Department. The arrest occurred at or near Manahan Beach, Route 9 & Icehouse Road, Hillsboro, NH 03244, and is recorded under reference number 24HI-212-AR.

Specifically, I request:

All available body-worn camera footage from any officers involved in this arrest.

All relevant dash camera footage from Hillsboro Police cruisers present at the scene.

All rear-seat (in-cruiser) camera footage, especially during the period when Ms. Lecomte caused damage to the transport area and later assaulted an officer.

The complete incident and arrest reports, including officer narratives, booking and transport records, and any supplemental documentation.

Incident Summary:

Name: Hannah Lecomte

Gender: Female

Age at Arrest: 21

Race: White

Arrest Date: July 11, 2024

Location: Route 9 & Icehouse Road (Manahan Beach), Hillsboro, NH

Reference ID: 24HI-212-AR

Charges:

Simple Assault on a Police Officer

Resisting Arrest

Criminal Mischief

Unlawful Intoxication

Lecomte was reportedly underage and intoxicated, resisted arrest, and while secured in the cruiser, damaged the interior and assaulted an officer during transport or processing. She was later held in preventive detention at Hillsborough County House of Corrections.

This request is made in the public interest, not for commercial use. The requested materials pertain to police handling of an allegedly intoxicated young adult in custody, use of force, and possible cruiser damage. Disclosure would contribute meaningfully to public understanding of police procedures and detainee treatment.

I request a waiver of all applicable fees and digital delivery of responsive records where available. If any part of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation citing the specific legal exemption(s) under RSA 91-A.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Arrest of Katie N. Prock (CCPD 2024-01081) – March 28, 2024

communications.communication:
